thread.title: Showing growth: DraftKings releases strong financial numbers
thread.title_full: Showing growth: DraftKings releases strong financial numbers

title: Showing growth: DraftKings releases strong financial numbers
text: By Jack Pickell @pacmanjack Boston.com Staff | 10.23.15 | 7:32 AM Ads for daily fantasy sports sites seem to be everywhere you look these days, so it might not come as too much of a shock to hear that Boston-based DraftKings just released some heady financial numbers. According to BetaBoston , DraftKings reported receiving $304 million in user entry fees, compared to $45 million in 2013. The company reported $40 million in 2014 revenue, up from $3 million a year earlier.   Femi Wasserman, DraftKings’s vice president of communications, said that DraftKings is gaining a larger share of the market all the time. “DraftKings is a growing company in growing niche, which is a nice place to be,” she said. Rival FanDuel recently released its 2014 financial information, reporting $622 million in entry fees and $57 million in revenue, according to BetaBoston. Read the full BetaBoston story here . Contact Jack Pickell at: jack.pickell@boston.com . Follow him on Twitter: @pacmanjack Most Popular
